sentences.english: Calmly wait ’til they’re done, and then provide the answer.
sentences.chinese: 冷静地等待，直到他们说完，然后再给出你的回答。

sentences.english: I think Chinese people should understand their personal experience and keep temper.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得中国人应该理解他们的个人经历并且保持冷静。

sentences.english: He is a very level-headed guy and very strong.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个非常冷静并且坚强的家伙。

sentences.english: "I figured he probably just needed some time to cool off, " Pagoria said.
sentences.chinese: “我想他可能是需要时间冷静一下，”帕格利亚说。

sentences.english: Behind the wall you are calm and peaceful.
sentences.chinese: 你在墙后，保持了安宁和冷静。
设置合理的冷静期制度。

sentences.english: Says captain smollett , as cool as can be.
sentences.chinese: 斯莫列特船长说，尽可能地保持着冷静。

sentences.english: Calmness is needed in melancholy days. Believe that pleasantness is coming.
sentences.chinese: 在心情忧郁的日子里你需要冷静，相信快乐即将到来。

sentences.english: We had to calm the children down after the excitement.
sentences.chinese: 兴奋过后，我们必须让孩子冷静下来。

sentences.english: They are the perfect masters of disguise; wearing masks of calm and collected beings.
sentences.chinese: 他们是伪装大师，头戴一副冷静的面具收集信息。

sentences.english: You may not be able to control the times, but you can compose your response.
sentences.chinese: 你也许不能控制时势，可是你能够冷静应对。

sentences.english: On this basis, the author rethinks it dispassionately and draws a conclusion.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上，冷静地对其反思，并得出自己的结论。

sentences.english: This is a normal activity that cats find calming and reassuring.
sentences.chinese: 这是猫儿们让自己冷静下来的惯常行动。

sentences.english: When I confront rejections, I tell myself to calm down and never give up.
sentences.chinese: 当我遭到拒绝时，我告诉自己冷静下来并且永不言弃。

sentences.english: I think his determination to come for crosses is calm but commanding.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他在出击传中球上很冷静而且很坚决。

sentences.english: Power of self-restraint, cool-headed , hope and confidence.
sentences.chinese: 自制的力量，冷静的头脑，希望和信心。

definition: Pinghe county in Zhangzhou 漳州[Zhang1 zhou1], Fujian
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
